page.title: 02Dilhorne Endowed School
page.content:
Dilhorne School was first built in the church yard of All Saints Church in the reign of Henry VIII, a free school and intended for the benefit of that parish by providing a stipend for the schoolmaster to teach the science of grammar.When in the late 1870's the school moved to its present location it became an Elementary School.
The Trust established then continues today, administered by a committee of local people, guided by its secretary who is a solicitor.Only the interest from the capital can be spent,firstly on the building and then on grants awarded to members of the village who attend any form of higher education over the age of sixteen.Each year the school also receives financial help towards the childrens education.
